channel.title: Display name system
channel.description:
james%5F \ says: 29) Timmy7072 asks; I hear rumours of a "Name Changing System" can this be confirmed? If so, how would such a system work? Yes, we are planning to release a new display name system shortly. This will essentially allow you to change your in-game display name to be different from your login name.
I was right :P [quote="oksuper_, post:4, topic:291607"]There are two 'name' fields now... I suspect one is for 'display name' or 'nickname'; Possibly a new feature?[/quote] BTW I give credits to MethoD for originally notifying me of the second field and asking about what it could be used for :p So what do you guys think... good idea?

item.dc:creator: @light232 light232
item.description:
@light232 wrote:

[quote=“xeez`, post:17, topic:293532”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=388396.msg2904333#msg2904333 date=1249706517]

Such as more graphics updates, DirectX, stuff to allow the client to run better on more computers.

Why would they use DirectX?

  1. Tied to 1 platform.
    [/quote]
    I’m not entirely sure this would stop them from using it :P. This hasn’t stopped them from using native libraries such as DLL’s.[/quote]
    java native intefaces are needed

item.title: Display name system
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“xeez`, post:19, topic:293532”][quote author=frank_ link=topic=388396.msg2905996#msg2905996 date=1249800942]

[quote author=xeez` link=topic=388396.msg2905985#msg2905985 date=1249800480]
I’m not entirely sure this would stop them from using it :P. This hasn’t stopped them from using native libraries such as DLL’s.
[/quote]they have libs for unix based OSs too
[/quote]I’m sure they do, although what my post implied was the fact that if they detect that a user is using a windows OS, for example, they can operate on an entirely different graphics library (DirectX) rather than openGL, just as they do with native libraries. :)[/quote]which would create more work and cause confusion, and somehow lead to ww3.

Read full topic

item.title: Display name system
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“xeez`, post:19, topic:293532”][quote author=frank_ link=topic=388396.msg2905996#msg2905996 date=1249800942]

[quote author=xeez` link=topic=388396.msg2905985#msg2905985 date=1249800480]
I’m not entirely sure this would stop them from using it :P. This hasn’t stopped them from using native libraries such as DLL’s.
[/quote]they have libs for unix based OSs too
[/quote]I’m sure they do, although what my post implied was the fact that if they detect that a user is using a windows OS, for example, they can operate on an entirely different graphics library (DirectX) rather than openGL, just as they do with native libraries. :)[/quote]But they are the same libraries, just ported for a unix-based OS. OpenGL and DirectX are completely different libraries requireing completely different implementations.

I really don’t see why there is an argument. The facts are simple:

1: On a Windows system: DirectX > OpenGL
2: If jagex were to implement a graphics library it would be OpenGL to maintain platform independance.

Read full topic

item.title: Display name system
item.dc:creator: @xeez xeez`
item.description:
@xeez wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:18, topic:293532”][quote author=xeez` link=topic=388396.msg2905985#msg2905985 date=1249800480]
I’m not entirely sure this would stop them from using it :P. This hasn’t stopped them from using native libraries such as DLL’s.
[/quote]they have libs for unix based OSs too[/quote]I’m sure they do, although what my post implied was the fact that if they detect that a user is using a windows OS, for example, they can operate on an entirely different graphics library (DirectX) rather than openGL, just as they do with native libraries.

Read full topic

item.title: Display name system
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Bryanc, post:14, topic:293532”]OpenGL will remain an option, DirectX is just another option. It’s suppose to allow the game to use less memory to run it. Along with adding some more features; particles, etc. could also be put into OpenGL too.

Now yeah it would only be for Windows users yes, but it’s just an option to help open the game up to more players. Since it will be able to run on even lower end machines better than it’s current status with that.[/quote]

Using DirectX exclusively in Java is like using a cup to only drink water. If you’re going to make your application limited to one platform, then program specifically for that platform, not for platform-independence.

Read full topic

item.title: Display name system
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

OpenGL will remain an option, DirectX is just another option. It’s suppose to allow the game to use less memory to run it. Along with adding some more features; particles, etc. could also be put into OpenGL too.

Now yeah it would only be for Windows users yes, but it’s just an option to help open the game up to more players. Since it will be able to run on even lower end machines better than it’s current status with that.

Read full topic

directx relies on you to ‘use’ the hardware
opengl has it implemented[/quote]
pretty sure opengl is just an interface to the hardware… as is directx…

item.description:
@ownagesbot wrote:

[quote=“oksuper_, post:1, topic:293532”][quote]james%5F \ says:
29) Timmy7072 asks;
I hear rumours of a “Name Changing System” can this be confirmed? If so, how would such a system work?

Yes, we are planning to release a new display name system shortly. This will essentially allow you to change your in-game display name to be different from your login name.
[/quote]

I was right

There are two ‘name’ fields now… I suspect one is for ‘display name’ or ‘nickname’; Possibly a new feature?

BTW I give credits to MethoD for originally notifying me of the second field and asking about what it could be used for

So what do you guys think… good idea?[/quote]like u giv a fuck if its a gud idea, u r just hear to gloat!1!! rep++ tho man well predicted!

item.title: Display name system
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

Lol yeah it’s true. But they MAY do that, its in development and has been, along with some other things. Such as more graphics updates, DirectX, stuff to allow the client to run better on more computers. Some more particle stuff, etc.

Should be fun to see what they have.

You can verify this with the Q&A they have posted answers too, and the live Q&A they had yesterday.

Read full topic

If that’s true, I can’t wait to login using mod.taharok@gmail.com

Yes, we are planning to release a new display name system shortly. This will essentially allow you to change your in-game display name to be different from your login name.
